name: Experiential Learning Project
markup:
Experiential Learning Project

This course includes an experiential learning project.

Review the instructor’s tasks in this document to manage and lead your students successfully towards completion of this project.

  • Experiential Learning Project (ELP): Before, During, & After for Instructors

Use this set of slides in your first live session; it includes the main points you should cover to introduce your course and the experiential learning project. Note: You need to customize the content in these slides for your course and your experiential learning project.

Follow the guides in the Notes section; they indicate when to use share screen in your presentation to provide overviews of course documents and the Riipen platform.

  • Experiential Learning Project Introduction (PowerPoint download)

Groups

markup:
Assignments

  • If your course uses Turnitin, you may need to re-enable the settings. In the event that you see “Error enabling Turnitin®,” refer to the following guide:
    Manually Enabling Turnitin

name: Discussions note to LST
markup: Note to integrator: There are three options available for Discussions: individual, threaded groups, and separate topics. Remove the ones that don't apply as well as this note.

markup:

Discussions - Separate topics

name: Quizzes - Unhide, Dates, Submission Views
markup:
Quizzes

  • Activate quizzes – VERY IMPORTANT: Avenue sets quizzes to hidden status by default. You must unhide quizzes for students to access them.
  • Update Quiz Availability Dates
  • Update Additional Submission View Dates – VERY IMPORTANT: There is an additional submission view in each quiz that releases the correct answers. If the additional submission view in each quiz is not set correctly for the current term, students will be given the correct answers immediately following their first quiz attempt, prior to the quiz deadline. Set the additional submission view date in each quiz for the Monday following the quiz deadline, e.g., if the quiz is due March 11 at 11:59 PM, set the additional view for March 12 at 12:01 AM.

name: Quizzes - Unhide, Dates
markup:
Quizzes

  • Activate quizzes – VERY IMPORTANT: Avenue sets quizzes to hidden status by default. You must unhide quizzes for students to access them.
  • Update Quiz Availability Dates

name: Quizzes - Unhide
markup:
Quizzes

  • Activate quizzes – VERY IMPORTANT: Avenue sets quizzes to hidden status by default. You must unhide quizzes for students to access them.

name: Calendar

Calendar

name: Tracking sheet
markup:
Tracking Sheet

If you would like any changes or updates to be reflected in the Master Shell of the course and, therefore, the next course offering, please use the Tracking Sheet to indicate those changes.

To access the Tracking Sheet, go to the Course Updates Track Changes module in Content and click Tracking Sheet Information.

Please be sure to submit your Tracking Sheet to your PM before the end of the course. Changes may not be completed in the Master by the next term offering.

name: Course Facilitation
markup:
Course Facilitation

During the course, make use of the following facilitation resources:

name: Grading
markup:
Grading

  • Entering Grades
  • Grading Assignments
  • Grading Discussions

name: Video Notes
markup:
Video Notes

A video note is a short video clip of yourself that can be shared with students in Avenue to Learn. Video notes are created using your computer’s webcam and Avenue to Learn’s built-in media recording tool. A video note can be added using any HTML editor with the Insert Stuff button – .

Common places video notes are supported include Announcements, Assignment feedback, and Discussions.

  • Creating a Video Note

name: Class Progress
markup:
Class Progress

Use the Class Progress tool to view a summary of each studentâ€™s grades, completion of learning objectives, access of content topics, participation in discussions, assignment submissions, quiz submissions, checklist completion, survey responses, and login history.

  • Checking Class Progress

name: Chat
markup:
Chat

The Avenue to Learn Chat tool is a text-based, synchronous communication tool. General chats exist only within the course shell in which they are created, and are available to all users in the course shell, regardless of role.

Communication within a general chat is automatically recorded and can be accessed by all users in the course, whether they have participated in the chat session or not. Only users with instructor access can create and delete general chats.

  • Using the Chat Tool

name: Final Grades
markup:
Final Grades

You are required to submit final calculated grades at the end of the course. Choose one of the following options below based on your course structure (if you are unsure, contact the Program Associate).

  • Option A: Loading Avenue to Learn Grades in Mosaic
  • Option B: Manually Entering Grades in Mosaic

name: Reflection
markup:
Reflection

Reflect on your practice and note what worked during the delivery of the course. If there are any changes that could make the facilitation more effective for future course deliveries, please share your ideas with the Program Manager.

name: Required Materials - Online orders and bookstore
markup:
Online orders are the preferred method of ordering any required print materials (telephone orders are no longer accepted at the bookstore). If you wish to visit the main campus to purchase your material from the bookstore, we strongly recommend you call first to see if your course materials are in stock.

The bookstore has provided detailed information for using the online ordering system, and shipping details. We recommend you view this information before you attempt to place your order. Proceed to Course Materials (hyperlink opens in a new tab).

name: Required Materials - Accommodation
markup: Students who require course materials in an alternative format due to accessibility reasons should contact Student Accessibility Services (hyperlink opens in a new tab).

name: Required Materials - Articles
markup:
Articles

Specified in each module.

name: Required Materials - Articles and ebooks
markup:
Articles and eBooks

The study materials for this course include articles from scholarly journals and/or eBooks that are available through the McMaster Library.

To access a journal article, use the citation information listed on the module pages to locate the article through the Online Journals tab of the McMaster Library Homepage (hyperlink opens in a new tab).

If you are new to the McMaster Library and require further information on finding journal articles, the library has an extensive set of How Library Stuff Works (hyperlink opens in a new tab) videos that provide detailed instructions.

To access an eBook, search for the title of the eBook using the search function on the McMaster Library Homepage (hyperlink opens in a new tab).

In order to view the full text of a journal article and/or access an eBook, you will need to log in to the library system using your MAC ID and password.

name: Required Materials - Lynda.com
markup:
Lynda.com

This course contains videos and resources from Lynda.com. To access the content, you are required to create a profile. Click the “Log In to lynda.com” button on Lynda.mcmaster.ca (hyperlink opens in a new tab), enter your MAC ID and Password, and follow the prompts provided.

If you already have a profile, click the “Log In to lynda.com” button on Lynda.mcmaster.ca (hyperlink opens in a new tab) and enter your MAC ID and password to search for and access content.

name: Required Materials - Microsoft Office 365
markup:
Microsoft Office 365

Microsoft Office 365 is available for all McMaster students. It is a cloud-based software suite that includes versions of Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

For more information and how to download this software, go to Microsoft Office 365 for Students (hyperlink opens in a new tab).

name: Required Materials - WebEx
markup:
WebEx

This course may include live online sessions using WebEx videoconferencing software (see the Detailed Course Schedule for dates and times).

To participate in these sessions, you will require:

  • A stable internet connection
  • A speaker or headphones
  • A working microphone
  • A webcam (optional)

For more information about using WebEx, please review McMaster WebEx Support Wiki – Resources For Students (hyperlink opens in a new tab)

Your instructor will record all WebEx sessions. If you are unable to attend a session, your instructor will provide you access to the recording.
